mainEntity.name: How long does it take to hike Hamlin Peak?

acceptedAnswer.text: Most routes on Hamlin Peak take 5-7 hours round trip. The most popular trail is 10.6 miles with Strenuous difficulty. Start early, especially on weekends when parking fills quickly.

mainEntity.name: Is Hamlin Peak hard to hike?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hamlin Peak is rated Strenuous. At 4,756 feet, expect challenging terrain above treeline with potential for rapid weather changes. Proper footwear and preparation are essential.

mainEntity.name: Do I need a permit to hike Hamlin Peak?

acceptedAnswer.text: No hiking permit is required for Hamlin Peak. However, parking fees may apply at trailheads (typically $3-5/day for WMNF or state parks). A WMNF parking pass covers most White Mountain trailheads.

mainEntity.name: What is the best trail to hike Hamlin Peak?

acceptedAnswer.text: The most popular route is the Hamlin Ridge Trail, offering Ridge route to Hamlin with extensive above-treeline hiking..

mainEntity.name: When is the best time to hike Hamlin Peak?

acceptedAnswer.text: The best hiking season for Hamlin Peak is late May through October. Summer and fall offer the best conditions, though expect crowds on weekends. Winter hiking requires specialized gear and experience.

page_content.description:
At 4,756 feet, Hamlin Peak ranks among New Hampshire's celebrated 4000-Footers—a collection of 48 peaks that challenge and inspire hikers throughout the Northeast. This strenuous summit offers a quintessential White Mountain experience.

Popular Routes

The most popular route, **Hamlin Ridge Trail**, covers 10.6 miles and is rated Strenuous. Ridge route to Hamlin with extensive above-treeline hiking.

Peak Bagging

**Extend Your Adventure:** Mount Katahdin - Baxter Peak lies just 1.1 miles away, making it an excellent addition for ambitious hikers looking to bag multiple summits.

spring.title: Spring Conditions
spring.conditions: Muddy trails, snow above 3000ft until May
spring.tips: Trail closures for mud season (April-May). Check conditions before heading out.

summer.title: Summer Conditions
summer.tips: Start early to avoid afternoon storms and parking issues. Peak crowds on weekends.

fall.title: Fall Conditions
fall.conditions: Peak foliage late Sept, early snow possible in October
fall.tips: Peak foliage brings peak crowds. Weekday hikes recommended. Watch for ice above treeline in late October.

winter.title: Winter Conditions
winter.conditions: Full winter conditions, extreme cold and wind above treeline
winter.tips: Winter hiking requires specialized skills and gear. Never hike alone. Check avalanche conditions for steeper terrain.
